project_abstract.cdata: The principal objectives of the Telecommunications Project are to provide Western Samoa with an appropriate and cost effective solution for its immediate and medium-term telecommunications requirements and provide a low-cost incremental expansion path for its longer-term telecommunications requirements. Specifically, the project will: (i) upgrade the telecommunications system between the country's principal population and commercial centers; (ii) improve the international gateway access through the provision of 100 international lines; (iii) replace obsolete equipment that is no longer practicable to maintain; (iv) introduce modern and appropriate technology that is less maintenance intensive than existing equipment; (v) provide basic infrastructure for the subsequent development of rural telecommunications; and (vi) provide sufficient capacity on the national and international network to remove bottlenecks and ensure that capacity is in place to handle forecasted traffic growth.
